content:
• Monday, July 2, 2018
  • FB

    Report: Feds expand data probe into Facebook; shares -1.4%

    • A federal probe into Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is expanding, The Washington Post reports, with three agencies now parsing the company's statements over data-leak dealings with Cambridge Analytica.
    • The FBI, SEC and Federal Trade Commission have joined the Justice Dept. in the investigation, the report says.
    • Emphasis has been on whether Facebook's public declarations about the scandal square with underlying facts, and whether Facebook has been complete and timely about what it's said.
    • Shares are down 1.4% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 91 Comments
  • RAMP

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (7/2/2018)

    • Top Gainers: ACXM +18%. MLHR +12%. MXC +4%. GLDD +3.9%. GHDX +3%.
    • Top Losers: GBR -6.7%. HZN -6%. PCMI -3%. OTC:DHCP -2.8%. SUPV -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock +3.9% on $164M in awards

    • Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (NASDAQ:GLDD) is up 3.9% after hours following its announcement of $164M in awarded contracts.
    • That includes four deals for coastal protection (in New York, South Carolina, North Carolina and Maryland) along with the Corpus Christi La Quinta Channel Widening Project in Texas and the Delaware River Deepening Variation Order.
    • The company expects the coastal protection projects to be executed between now and May 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • RAMP

    Acxiom sells bulk of company to Interpublic for $2.3B (updated)

    • Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM) -- on the move in recent days as reports about selling its data-marketing unit heated up -- has a definitive all-cash deal to sell the unit for $2.3B to Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG).
    • That's higher than even the latest report of $2.2B. The deal's expected to close by the end of the calendar year.
    • The Acxiom Marketing Solutions Business makes up most of Acxiom's business.
    • Acxiom expects to realize about $1.7B in net cash proceeds, which it will use to retire its entire $230M in debt; launch a $500M cash tender for common stock; increase its buyback authorization by up to $500M; and fund growth initiatives, strategic acquisition opportunities and cash needs.
    • It's also transferring the Acxiom brand to IPG, and plans to rename itself LiveRamp (after its faster-growing remaining business) and seek the ticker symbol RAMP.
    • Shares in Acxiom rose steadily throughout the day to finish at a 14.2% gain.
    • Updated 5:13 p.m.: Shares are up another 17.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR): Q4 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $618M (+7.1% Y/Y) beats by $16.9M.
    • Shares +6.82%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • PLT

    Plantronics +2.1% on closing Polycom acquisition

    • Plantronics (NYSE:PLT) completes its acquisition of Polycom.
    • The acquisition is immediately accretive to non-GAAP EPS. Plantronics believes it can achieve annual run-rate cost synergies of $75M within 12 months. 
    • Plantronics acquired Polycom at a $2B enterprise value with the total consideration consisting of $1.64B in cash and 6.352M Plantronics shares.   
    • Plantronics closed today up 2.1% to $77.81.   
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ELF

    M&A potential seen for e.l.f. Beauty

    • D.A. Davidson thinks e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) could be taken out at a 40% premium due to the recent decline in share price.
    • The M&A potential on ELF underpins D.A. Davidson's Buy rating on the online cosmetics stock.
    • Unilever (UN, UL, Coty (NYSE:COTY) and Revlon (NYSE:REV) are mentioned as potential acquirers of e.l.f. Beauty.
    • Shares of ELF are down 28% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 25 Comments
  • NLNK

    NewLink's indoximod shows positive action in early-stage study in aggressive type of brain tumor; shares up 3%

    • NewLink Genetics (NLNK +3.4%) is up on below-average volume on its announcement of updated data from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing indoximod + front-line radiation + maintenance chemo in patients with newly diagnosed diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma (DIPG), a treatment-resistant and aggressive type of tumor that starts in the brain stem. The results were presented at the International Symposium of Pediatric Neuro-Oncology Annual Meeting in Denver, CO.
    • All 10 treated patients showed initial symptomatic improvement. Nine of the 10 remain on study, the longest being 8.5 months. Historically, median survival is only nine months.
    • On the safety front, an unspecified subset of patients experienced adverse events, including inflammation, which were actively managed.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • MARK

    Remark amends financing, purchase agreements

    • Remark Holdings (NASDAQ:MARK) enters into an amended financing agreement with its lenders extending the repayment of $11.5M until September 28.
    • The company also entered into a common stock purchase agreement with Aspire Capital allowing Aspire to buy as much as $30M of Remark stock over a 30-month term. 
    • Remark plans to deploy several AI products and will update investors on that process during the Q2 earnings call.   
    • Remark shares are up 1.3% to $3.96.    
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • AXMP

    AXM Pharma agrees to reverse merger with Cameroon cocoa exporter; shares up 118%

    • Thinly traded nano cap AXM Pharma (OTC:AXMP +117.6%) rockets on a healthy 18x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it has inked a binding letter agreement for a reverse takeover by privately held AS Industries Cameroon (ASIC), a cocoa exporter.
    • ASIC chief Emmanuel Neossi has acquired 70% of AXMP and has been appointed Chairman, replacing Mandla Gwadiso who stepped down.
    • The combined company will do business as AS Industries Cameroon.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron, Canadian Natural have lagged but ready to move up, Goldman says

    • Chevron (CVX -2%) and Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -1.6%) have lagged the energy sector's recent rise, but Goldman Sachs analyst Neil Mehta thinks the stocks remain worthy of his Buy rating, reiterating respective $142 and $43 price targets.
    • CVX shares have been weighed down by skepticism about the company's ability to execute, its appetite for M&A and its focus in the congested Permian Basin, but Mehta still likes the stock, and he thinks CVX may announce stock buybacks and production updates about the Wheatstone Train 2 LNG project in Australia that could provide a boost.
    • CNQ has underperformend after a lackluster Q1 and because of its exposure to weak Canadian commodity prices, Mehta says, but he remains bullish on the belief that CNQ will benefit from strong cash flow returns this year, which will shore up the balance sheet and allow it to return more cash to shareholders.
    • By contrast, Mehta reiterates a Sell rating and $42 price target on PBF Energy (PBF -1.3%), citing "concerns around the free cash flow power of the company, limited capital returns relative to refining peers, and history of operational underperformance."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 10 Comments
  • OBMP

    OncBioMune on go with mid-stage study of therapeutic prostate cancer vaccine; shares up 15%

    • Nano cap OncBioMune Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:OBMP +14.8%) is up on below-average volume on the news that it has engaged a CRO to manage a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead candidate ProscaVax for the first-line treatment of patients with localized prostate cancer, the first mid-stage study evaluating a prostate cancer vaccine in an active surveillance mode.
    • The 120-subject study should commence this quarter.
    • ProscaVax is a combination of prostate specific antigen (PSA) and the biological adjuvants interleukin-2 (IL-2) and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • RAMP

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: ACXM +13%. AMRH +11%. VMW +10%. SYNT +9%. DVMT +9%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:LFIN -17%. AGMH -16%. SPCB -14%. UXIN -9%. APPN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill announces exit from Chapter 11

    • Seadrill (SDRL -34.9%) says it has emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy after successfully completing its reorganization plan.
    • SDRL says the plan equitizes ~$2.4B in unsecured bond obligations, $1B-plus in contingent newbuild obligations and substantial unliquidated guaranty obligations while extending near term debt maturities, providing the company with more than $1B in fresh capital.
    • The company will list its new common shares on the NYSE under the same SDRL ticker, but investors "should take note of the anticipated cancellation of the existing shares and issuance of new common shares, and the two different CUSIP numbers signifying the existing shares and the new common shares."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 151 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla victory lap ends early

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) is down 2.52% after an initial vibrant rally this morning following the company's update on production, deliveries and reservations.
    • Volume on Tesla is over 14.3M shares vs. a 50-day avergage volume of 8.05M shares with two full hours of trading still on the clock.
    • Chiming in today on Tesla and the 5K Model 3 production run rate was CFRA analyst Efraim Levy. "In the interim, we do not see this production rate as operationally or financially sustainable," warned Levy. "However, over time, we expect the manufacturing rate to become sustainable and even rise. As usual, we expect the bulls and bears to largely reiterate their views after the latest development," he added.
    • CFRA lowered Tesla to a Sell rating from Hold to conform to its 12-month price target of $300 on the EV automaker.
    • Previously: Tesla updates on production and reservations (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 227 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +144%. SAEX +47%. MXC +35%. ZKIN +34%. UUUU +11%.
    • Losers: CLB -12%. PES -8%. FRAC -8%. HK -7%. SPN -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation soars after business update

    • Roadrunner Transportation Systems (NYSE:RRTS) jumps 31.6% after the company plays catch-up with its financial reporting and issues a positive assessment on current trends.
    • "Our recovery efforts are well timed, with an overall positive freight market. We know that improved short-term results while at times be bumpy and inconsistent, but looking at the bigger longer term picture, we are committed to improving each of our segments and our consolidated bottom-line results," noted Roadrunner CEO Curtis Stoelting on today's earnings call (transcript).
    • RRTS is still down 64% YTD as the effects of an accounting scandal are still being felt.
    • Previously: Roadrunner Transportation Systems up 6.2% post Q1 results (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 8 Comments
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +12%. GROW +10%. PFBC +7%. ELVT +6%. SIEB +6%.
    • Losers: DDR -21%. JTPY -8%. HCC -6%. BFR -6%. GEC -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • GBR

    Midday Gainers / Losers (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +153%. SAEX +54%. ADMP +37%. BLFS +30%. RRTS +28%. ZKIN +25%. BASI +22%. DAC +14%. BRFS +14%. LBIX-OLD +14%.
    • Losers: OTC:MDXG -38%. ALV -30%. NEWA -23%. DDR -21%. OTCPK:LFIN -19%. NVTR -17%. TKAT -16%. SPCB -15%. DFBG-OLD -14%. AGMH -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • MLCO

    Melco Resorts a leading decliner in Macau sell-off

    • Shares of Melco Resorts & Entertainment (NASDAQ:MLCO) are down 9.60% to their lowest level of 2018 after industry-wide June Macau gross gaming revenue numbers were reported below expectations (+12% vs. +18% consensus).
    • Some traders see the move as overdone with Macau posting a streak of 23 straight months of revenue gains and topping +20% growth for several months this year. Melco is also coming off a quarter of record adjusted EBITDA.
    • Previously: Macau casino revenue cools off in June (July 1)
    • Previously: Macau sector slides after June GGR disappoints (July 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 11 Comments
  • DLPH

    Jittery trading on auto supplier stocks

    • Auto supplier stocks are down amid more anxiety over the tariff battles between the U.S. and EU nations, China, Canada and Mexico.
    • The automobile industry is particularly sensitive to tariff wildcards due to the lengthy advance time on purchasing and manufacturing decisions.
    • Notable decliners include Delphi Technologies (DLPH -2.8%), Modine Manufacturing (MOD -3.3%), WABCO Holdings (WBC -2.5%), Visteon (VC -2.7%), Workhorse Group (WKHS -2.7%), Allison Transmission (ALSN -2.1%), Cooper-Standard (CPS -2.1%) and Aptiv (APTV -1.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • VDNRF

    Vedanta Resources chairman's family trust to buy rest of company

    • Vedanta Resources (OTCPK:VDNRF +25.8%) surges in London trading after chairman Anil Agarwal’s family trust agrees to acquire the rest of the company it does not already own in a deal that values the mining conglomerate at £2.3B ($3.03B).
    • Agarwal's Volcan Investments, which currently holds 66.53% of Vedanta, made a cash offer for 825 pence per share, a 27.6% premium to Friday's closing price of 646.8 pence.
    • After delisting of Vedanta Resources, Agarwal would have just two listed companies in India: Vedanta Ltd. - which contains his sprawling copper, silver, lead, iron ore, power, aluminum mining and oil and gas - and Hindustan Zinc.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALGN

    Align Tech prevails in legal challenge to Invisalign store pilot program

    • Align Technology (ALGN -1.7%) has won the first round in a legal spat between the company and SDC Financial LLC and SmileDirectClub LLC regarding its Invisalign stores.
    • The plaintiffs allege that Align's pilot program breaches non-compete provisions that apply to members of SDC Financial LLC. Remedies requested include the preliminary and permanent enjoinment of all activities related to the pilot program, including the closure of all Invisalign stores and a prohibition on opening new stores, and allowing SDC entities to exercise their right to repurchase all of Align's SDC Financial LLC membership interests at a price equal to Align's current capital account balance.
    • On Friday, June 29, a Tennessee court denied the SDC entities' request for a temporary injunction preventing Align from opening new stores. The company says it intends to continue the pilot program and will "vigorously defend itself" in arbitration proceedings currently scheduled for December 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDP

    NYP: Cavs owner, Robbins in group bidding for SI

    • A consortium including Velocity Group's Joshua Pollack, Cleveland Cavaliers owner Dan Gilbert and motivational speaker Tony Robbins are bidding for Sports Illustrated, the New York Post says.
    • That's ahead of a 5 p.m. deadline for bids for the venerable magazine brand, one of several former Time Inc. titles being unloaded by Meredith (MDP +2.1%) after it acquired Time.
    • Meredith is reportedly hoping for $200M in a sale of SI.
    • The Pollack group is also said to be interested in the bidding for Fortune and Money (bids for those were due June 29).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • GBR

    New Concept Energy more than doubles, extending recent run-up

    • Volatile New Concept Energy (GBR +158.1%) skyrockets to its highest levels in 16 years, with no apparent news to explain the move.
    • The stock closed at just $1.42 as recently as last Wednesday; it has gained 754% in the last month and 669% YTD.
    • GBR has properties in the Appalachian Basin and Utica Basin, and its website says it is "looking to acquire controlling interest in several projects."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 8 Comments
  • BRFS

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: BRFS +13%. PETZ +10%. PERY +7%. ELF +6%. RIBT +5%.
    • Losers: ALV -30%. PME -11%. NAKD -8%. SUMR -6%. RCKY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • NKE

    Nike down nearly 3% as Federer exits

    • The all-time great walked onto Center Court Wimbledon today in an outfit by Japan's Uniqlo. His contract with Nike (NKE -2.8%) had expired on March 1.
    • Terms of Federer's deal with Uniqlo weren't disclosed, but ESPN is reporting a guarantee of $300M over 10 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 32 Comments
  • COP

    FT: Conoco’s redeployment out of Permian only temporary, Lance says

    • ConocoPhillips (COP -1.2%) CEO Ryan Lance said last month that the company was looking at redeploying resources out of the Permian Basin because of the shortage of pipeline capacity in Texas, but he tells Financial Times that the action is only a temporary delay after the company was taken by surprise by how quickly the pipelines for taking oil out of the region had filled up.
    • COP does not have firm commitments for pipeline capacity to take its oil from the Permian Basin to refineries or export terminals, and has needed to book space on pipelines as available, which has caused it to think about slowing down the rate at which it is drilling and completing wells in the Permian.
    • While Lance is "not sure it makes sense to drill into that headwind," he also wants to keep working in the Permian to learn about how to operate there, so that “when we’re ready to go into full manufacturing mode, we’re there and we’re optimized."
    • If COP does redeploy resources, they would not go out of the U.S. but to other shale oil regions such as the Eagle Ford of south Texas or the Bakken of North Dakota, where it has transport facilities booked and can secure better prices for its production.
    • The CEO says activity in the Permian could be ramped back up again as new pipelines are built, adding 1.5M-2M of new takeaway capacity by early 2020, some of which COP has booked for its expected production.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • BTC-USD

    Big bounce for cryptos; GBTC up 16%

    • Bitcoin (BTC-USD) plunged to as low as about $5.7K late last week, but has returned to $6.6K at current check, up 5% on today's session. Ether (ETH-USD), Ripple (XRP-USD), and Litecoin (LTC-USD) have bounced similar amounts.
    • OTCQX:GBTC +16.5%
    • The WSJ has an interesting pice from Andy Kessler, tracing Bitcoin's meteoric rise to Tether (USDT-USD). Fixed at $1, more Tether needed to be issued as the price of Bitcoin rose. Proceeds from said issuance were plowed in Bitcoin. Rinse. Repeat. Trouble began, though, when Bitcoin's inevitable rise became less so.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 30 Comments
  • DOMO

    Domo -11% on second day of trading

    • Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) closed its rocky first day of trading on Friday up 30% to $27.30. The analytics company has lost some of those gains today with shares currently down 11% to $24.34. 
    • Previously: Domo +13% on open of first trading day (June 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SUPN

    Piper on the fence with volume growth of Supernus Pharma's Trokendi XR; shares down 5%

    • Supernus Pharmaceuticals (SUPN -4.7%) slips on below-average volume on the heels of a note from Piper Jaffray's David Amsellem (Neutral/$47) stating that the results from an in-house survey of 25 neurologists suggested weakening volume growth for top seller Trokendi XR which accounted for 77% of the company's 2017 product sales ($226.5M/294.1M).
    • Mr. Amsellem adds that the significance of the pressure on volume/sales growth is "unclear" but he believes Trokendi XR will not be a significant revenue growth drive in the coming years.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 13 Comments
  • MDGL

    Nash players in the green as potential deals loom

    • Certain companies developing treatments for nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) continue to see positive money flow as bullish investors see continued upside and expected M&A activity.
    • Selected tickers: (MDGL +5%)(VKTX +2.3%)(ICPT +2%)(CNAT +2.3%)(GLMD +2.1%)(VBLT +1.1%)(GALT +4.2%)(OTCPK:GNFTF)(CANF +0.9%)(RGLS +1.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 99 Comments
  • CTIC

    CTI Bio's mid-stage study of pacritinib in myelofibrosis to continue as planned; shares up 3%

    • Thinly traded micro cap CTI BioPharma (CTIC +2.6%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement that its Phase 2 clinical trial, PAC203, assessing JAK2 inhibitor pacritinib in myelofibrosis patients previously treated with Incyte's Jakafi (ruxolitinib) will continue as planned without modification.
    • Enrollment of up to 150 subjects should be completed before year-end.
    • The primary endpoint of the open-label dose-finding study is the percent reduction in spleen volume from baseline at week 24.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • VRSN

    VeriSign up on price target boosts

    • Cowen raises its VeriSign (NASDAQ:VRSN) price target from $120 to $135, a 2% downside to Friday’s close.
    • Rating maintained at Market Perform.
    • More action: JPMorgan raises its VeriSign target from $107 to $122.   
    • VeriSign shares are up 0.7% to $138.38.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAMP

    Acxiom +11.5% as Interpublic reportedly nears $2.2B unit deal

    • Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM) is up 11.5% today after a Reuters report suggests Interpublic Group (IPG -2.4%) is nearing a $2.2B deal to buy Acxiom's marketing solutions division.
    • Shares had moved up Thursday with speculation growing about bids that could top $1.5B. A $2.2B deal for the data-marketing unit is almost more than Acxiom's market cap last week of $2.3B.
    • Acxiom's part in a deal that would sell off about three-quarters of its revenue is to focus on a faster growing area, its LiveRamp unit.
    • And Acxiom is expected to eventually explore a sale of its remaining business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo gets upgrade from Morgan Stanley after Fed's stress test

    • Wells Fargo (WFC +0.6%) upgraded by Morgan Stanley analyst Betsy Graseck  to equal-weight from underweight and boosted her price target to $62 from $57.
    • The upgrade comes after WFC passed the second half ot the Fed's annual stress tests for banks and announced plans to increase its Q3 dividend to 43 cents a share from 39 cents and buy back as much as $24.5B of its stock, more than double its 2017 stock repurchase program.
    • Previously: JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, American Express, Citi report dividend boosts, buybacks (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 8 Comments
  • ADMP

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (07/02/2018)

    • Gainers: ADMP +34%. BLFS +18%. VNRX +10%. INNT +9%. AKTX +9%.
    • Losers: OTC:MDXG -32%. NVTR -23%. OCUL -9%. NVRO -8%. GNMX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 6 Comments
  • NVCN

    Neovasc files for $100M mixed shelf offering; shares up 3%

    • Neovasc (NVCN +2.6%) has filed a preliminary prospectus for a $100M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 5 Comments
  • MYMX

    Nymox boost marketing plans for BPH med fexapotide triflutate in Europe; shares up 8%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Nymox (OTCQB:MYMX +7.8%) is up on 25% higher volume in response to its announcement of expanded marketing plans in Europe for fexapotide triflutate for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), or enlarged prostate. The broader commercial plan was enabled by a ramp-up in production to 50 g per batch (equivalent to 18K - 20K units of 2.5 mg).
    • The company says it expects to file a new marketing application in Europe replacing its prior application.
    • A U.S. marketing application is on tap for later this year.
    • Long-term shareholders recently invested an additional $18.25M in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GE

    GE still 'significantly overvalued,' J.P. Morgan's Tusa says

    • General Electric (GE -2.6%) slumps in early trading as longtime bear Stephen Tusa reiterates his Underweight rating and $11 price target on the stock, saying the company's turnaround strategy will not lead to a higher price.
    • The J.P. Morgan analyst says GE remains "significantly overvalued" after recent asset sales based on his sum-of-the-parts analysis: "At the current roughly $14 stock price, we calculate [the remaining company] needs to support ~$11 of value on the back of what we see as $0.40/$0.33 in EPS/[free cash flow] in 2019."
    • Tusa, who has been Underweight on GE since May 2016, sees "a reasonable bear case that... would imply $6 [per share] for [the remaining company] and a price target of $9."
    • "We still see structural concerns in the key Power markets, minimal margin for error on leverage, numerous tail liabilities at both GE and [GE Capital Services]," Tusa writes. "Perhaps not well understood is that 2019 is shaping up to be much like 2018, with management now messaging no decline in cash restructuring and only a modest decline in book restructuring."
    • Just last week, Tusa was out predicting GE's dividend will be cut "precipitously," perhaps in the "30%-plus range," by the end of 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 209 Comments
  • BAND

    Bandwidth -2.5% as Morgan Stanley backs off to Equal Weight

    • Bandwidth (NASDAQ:BAND) is 2.5% lower after a cut to Equal Weight by Morgan Stanley.
    • The firm still sees Bandwidth as a leader in CPaaS, but there's near-term dislocation after a 90% gain from the November IPO. The carrier is unlikely to see the big beats it needs to close a gap with peers until mid-2019 at the earliest. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • It's maintaining a price target of $40, now 8% upside from the currently lower price.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • RUN

    Sunrun +3.2% on target boost to 67% upside

    • Credit Suisse maintains an Outperform rating on Sunrun (NASDAQ:RUN) and raises the price target from $16 to $22, a 67% upside to Friday’s close.
    • Sunrun shares are up 3.2% to $13.57.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 6 Comments
  • BASI

    Bioanalytical Systems acquires Seventh Wave Labs for cash and stock; shares up 34%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Bioanalytical Systems (BASI +33.9%) is up on whopping 83x surge in volume on the heels of its announced asset purchase deal with Seventh Wave Laboratories, a provider of integrated services aimed at assessing the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals and medical devices that generated ~$11M in sales last year.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, BASI will issue 1.5M shares of its common stock and pay $7M in cash for all Seventh Wave assets.
    • To finance the cash portion, BASI borrowed $5.5M from First Internet Bank and increased its credit line to $3.5M from $2.0M.
    • When the transaction closes, Seventh Wave will own ~17% of BASI's common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • FNJN

    Finjan +2.1% on Trend Micro patent agreement

    • Finjan (NASDAQ:FNJN) and Trend Micro (OTCPK:TMICF) enter an ongoing license agreement that gives Trend Micro access to Finjan’s broad cybersecurity patent portfolio.
    • Finjan can transfer select security-related patent assets from Trend Micro.
    • Both parties also gain more limited access to the other’s patent portfolio for an unspecified number of years.
    • Finjan shares are up 2.1% to $3.47. 
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 10 Comments

    TechnipFMC wins subsea contract for Total’s Zinia 2 field

  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems up 6.2% post Q1 results

    • Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS +6.2%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 19% to $570M.
    • Segment revenue: TES increased 43.3% Y/Y to $326.1M,  due to an increase in ground and air expedited freight business which drove higher volumes and rates; LTL increased 4% Y/Y to $113.1M due to higher fuel surcharges and rates, partially offset by lower shipments where as Ascent decreased 25.1% Y/Y to $13.4M due to the divestiture of Unitrans.
    • Segment Adj. EBITDA: TES increased126 bps to3.3%; LTL declined 525 bps to -6.9% & Ascent increased 132 bps to 5.9%.
    • In Q1, the company announced the integration and rebranding of several operating companies, including Roadrunner Truckload Plus, into Ascent Global Logistics.
    • Also, the company restructured its temperature controlled truckload business which amounted to ~$5-7M in Q2 related to fleet and facilities right-sizing and severance costs.
    • The company issued and sold shares of Series E-1 Preferred Stock of ~$17.5M on March 1, 2018 and $17.5M on April 24, 2018.
    • The company has ~$40M of available funds for working capital and operating purposes from its existing borrowing capacity under its ABL facility and standby commitment from its preferred stock investor.
    • Positive 2018 Outlook: Expects improved operating and financial results throughout 2018 and a steady expansion of operating margins in future years.
    • Previously: Roadrunner Transportation reports Q1 results (July 2)

  • TSLA

    Tesla updates on production and reservations

    • Hang on tight because the Q2 delivery and production numbers are in from Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) this morning.
    • The company says Q2 production totaled 53,339 vehicles, up 55% Q/Q. Model 3 production came in at 28,578 units, while combined Model S and X production was 24,761 units.
    • During the last seven days of the quarter, production of 5,031 Model 3 and 1,913 Model S/X combines was realized.
    • "GA4, our new General Assembly line for Model 3, was responsible for roughly 20% of Model 3s produced last week, with quality from that line being as good as our regular GA3 line. We expect that GA3 alone can reach a production rate of 5,000 Model 3s per week soon, but GA4 helped to get us there faster and will also help to exceed that rate," updates Tesla.
    • Tesla expects to increase production to 6K Model 3s per week by late next month. Management also reaffirms guidance for positive GAAP net income and cash flow in Q3 and Q4, despite negative pressures from a weaker U.S. dollar and likely higher tariffs for vehicles imported into China as well as components procured from China.
    • Q2 deliveries totaled 40,740 vehicles, of which 18,440 were Model 3, 10,930 were Model S, and 11,370 were Model X. Tesla notes that 11,166 Model 3 vehicles and 3,892 Model S and X vehicles were in transit to customers at the end of Q2, and will be delivered in early Q3. The high number of customer vehicles in transit for Model 3 was primarily due to a significant increase in production towards the end of the quarter.
    • Interesting news on reservations is in from Tesla. "The remaining net Model 3 reservations count at the end of Q2 still stood at roughly 420,000 even though we have now delivered 28,386 Model 3 vehicles to date," updates the EV automaker. There's been plenty of speculation on how patient Model 3 reservation holders would be through the slow Model production ramp.
    • TSLA +5.99% premarket to $363.52.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 487 Comments

  • BHP

    Australia forecasts iron ore prices falling more than a fifth by 2020

    • Australia sees iron ore prices falling by more than 20% over the next two years as demand from China’s steel mills slips while domestic and Brazilian production increases, according to a new government report.
    • BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) -2%, Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) -1.8% and Vale (NYSE:VALE) -1.7% in premarket trading.
    • In its quarterly Resources and Energy report, Australia’s Department of Industry forecasts FOB iron ore prices will fall to an average of $51/metric ton in 2020, more than 21% below the current $65/ton.
    • The report also says near iron ore prices should find some support as steel prices themselves head higher, with a positive outlook for industrial production and a seasonal rebound in construction activity in China’s spring will shore up prices to average $59/ton FOB Australia this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM

  • WYNN

    Macau sector slides after June GGR disappoints

    • The Macau sector sold off in Hong Kong this morning, while in the U.S. premarket session Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) is down 3.79% and Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) is off 3.29%.
    • Union Gaming analyst Grant Govertsen notes that Macau casino business volume decelerated sharply in the last week of June. "We're surveying the market to see if there was a universal root cause, but at this point we're not concerned. Keep in mind that Macau has bad weeks all the time and one bad week doesn't make a trend," notes Govertsen.
    • He also points out the sector ran into a tough comparable from a year ago when June GGR was up 26%, but only attributes a small fraction of the revenue miss to World Cup fascination.
    • Macau casino stocks: Wynn Macau (OTCPK:WYNMF, OTCPK:WYNMY), Sands China (OTCPK:SCHYY, OTCPK:SCHYF), MGM China (OTCPK:MCHVF, OTCPK:MCHVY, MGM), Galaxy Entertainment (OTCPK:GXYEF), SJM Holdings (OTCPK:SJMHF, OTCPK:SJMHY), Melco Resorts & Entertainment (NASDAQ:MLCO).
